description: You are in a maze.
6549.name: Maze

description: You are still on the path to the castle, or back to the
Dwarven village, whichever way you wish to go.  The path
continues to the north and south.
6511.name: Still on the path to the Castle

description: You have entered the Mazekeeper's room.  There are pictures of
the Queen with darts thrown in it.  Spray-painted on the wall are
things like 'the queen shall suffer' and 'Catholics Rule'.
6553.name: The Mazekeeper's Room

description: This is a narrow path leading to the Dwarven Kingdom.  It looks less
travelled than the others, and it is very creepy.  The path opens up
to the south, and continues to the north.
6504.name: Narrow Path

description: Here there is a door to the castle to the east.  The castle
is elegantly designed, and looks much like a roll of toilet paper
standing on end.  A sign says:
*  WELCOME TO THE CASTLE OF STRANGELOVE  *
*      Here, celibacy is uninvited       *
6512.name: Door to Castle

description: You are on a path that will eventually lead to the castle.  It
continues north to the castle, and there is a door on the western wall.
6510.name: Path to the Castle

description: Now you are at the bottom of a rugged mountain.  The forest around you is
very dense, and it seems very dark to the north.
6501.name: Path, base of mountain

description: The path continues up the mountain.
The path heads toward the main city.
You are just inside the castle.  It is very tubular in shape,
and it is very featureless.  There is a set of stairs that lead
up, and the door leads out of the castle to the west.
6525.name: Inside of Castle Strangelove

description: You are on a path to the north of the Hide & Tooth shop.  The path
continues to the north, and there is Granite Head's bakery to the west.
6517.name: Path to the north of shop

description: This is the Queen's bedroom.  The bed is all ruffled, and there
is a stack of dirty sheets piled in the corner.
A note has been scrawled in lipstick on the mirror:
I'm out looking for my birth control pills.
Why don't you slip into something comfortable while you're waiting?
6532.name: Bedroom

description: Here is the back of the dwarven barracks.  There are rows
of beds here, and there is a stench that is unbearable.
6524.name: Back of Barracks

description: The stairs continue to circle up and down here.
6528.name: Stairs in castle

description: Here is the first of two main rooms of barracks.  The
barracks continue to the south, and you can leave the room
to the north.
6523.name: First Barrack room

description: You are in a maze.
6550.name: Maze

description: You are inside the maze, but not far enough in that you could get lost.
6547.name: Maze inscription

description: You are in the Hide & Tooth shop.  Here you may buy the finest in Dwarven
weapons and armors. The path continues to the north and east.
6516.name: Hide & Tooth Shop

description: There are holes everywhere from the places that the workers blew
away the rock to get to whatever they were looking for.  A path leads
down and up.
6542.name: Inside the mine

description: There is a wall poster of a nude Minne Pearl.
You are in the guard house to the west of the entrance
to the castle.  There are nude posters covering the walls.
6522.name: Guard House

description: You are on a path in the dwarven village which leads north to the shops
and south to the corner of the area.
6514.name: Path

description: You are inside the Dwarven Hospital.  It smells like rubbing
alcohol, and there is blood all over the walls.
6534.name: Hospital

description: A road wanders off the main path leading up the mountain to the
Dwarven Kingdom, the path leads back down the eastern side towards the
Dwarven Kingdom's Cargo Courier Building.  To the south the Holy Grove
can be seen, along with New Thalos and the Sands of Sorrow in the far
distance.
6536.name: {*Road to the {&D{*warven {&K{*ingdom {RC{rargo {RC{rourier{x

description: This is the storage room for equipment used by the
Dwarven miners.  It is very small, and you can tell that
not many miners actually use any equipment.
6551.name: Mining equipment room

description: They hang over the road in the most ominous of ways.
This is a narrow path that bends to the east here.  The trees hang over
the path, and it is very overgrown.  The narrow path continues to the
south and to the east.
6506.name: Bend in Narrow Path

description: The aroma coming from this room is sensuous.  You can almost taste
the pastries dissolving in your mouth.
6535.name: Granite Head's Bakery

description: This path is very narrow, and it continues to the north and west.
6507.name: Narrow path

description: Here is an entrance to the mountain.  The door looks very well built,
and you can hear noise coming from within.
6505.name: Entrance to Mountain

description: You are at the top of the stairs in the castle.  There is an exit
to the east, and the stairs lead down.
6530.name: Top of stairs

description: You have entered the maze of the mines.  To the east you
can see some inscriptions, and you can exit to the south.
6546.name: Mine Maze

description: You are now on the top of the mountain.  To the south you see a path
leading down the mountain.  To the east and west you see entrances to
what seems like mines.
6503.name: Top of mountain

description: An entrance to the mountain which seems to lead underground.
There is an entrance to the mountain.
The path leads down the mountain to the main city.
This is the Queen's waiting room.  Here the men literally
'wait' for the queen.  You've heard that the queen really likes
to get to 'know' her people, in the biblical sense.  The queen's
bedroom is to the north, and you can see stairs to the west.
6531.name: Queen's waiting room

description: You have solved the maze.  You can tell by the last few moves
that there is no way that a dumb worker could have figured that
out.  It seems pretty desolate here.  To the west is a bleak room.
To the east, you see the maze.  There is a sign above the west exit:
Those who enter, plan on a timely death.
Especially if you're loyal to the queen.
6552.name: Solved the Maze.

description: You are at a crossroad in the mine.  There is a door to the north,
and the path continues to the south, east, and west.
6544.name: Mine crossroad

description: Here the path bends to the east towards the barracks. To the
south you can see the shops.
6518.name: North of Shops

description: Here the path passes by the Hospital to the north.  It continues
to the east to the barracks, and to the west.
6519.name: Path by Hospital

description: A road wanders off the main path leading up the mountain to the
Dwarven Kingdom, the path leads back down the eastern side towards the
Dwarven Kingdom's Cargo Courier Building.  To the south the Holy Grove
can be seen, along with New Thalos and the Sands of Sorrow in the far
distance.  A set of large iron gates stands to the east.
6537.name: {*Road to the {&D{*warven {&K{*ingdom {RC{rargo {RC{rourier{x

description: Here the path turns to the west.  You can see a door in front of you,
and the path continues to the west and south.
6509.name: Door to Kingdom

description: After blowing all the dust off the floor, you notice a trapdoor!
There is a layer of dust on the floor at least 3 inches thick!  It is
probable that not many people have been in here for many months.
6526.name: A store room

description: A lighted area that looks like a well worn path.
You are inside the storage area for the raw materials
that are found down here.  The room is very unsturdy as the
supports are very rickety.
6545.name: Coal Room

description: A road wanders off the main path leading up the mountain to the
Dwarven Kingdom, the path leads back down the eastern side towards the
Dwarven Kingdom's Cargo Courier Building.  To the south the Holy Grove
can be seen, along with New Thalos and the Sands of Sorrow in the far
distance.
6533.name: {*Road to the {&D{*warven {&K{*ingdom {RC{rargo {RC{rourier{x

description: The little path here leads down toward the mines, while the worn path
continues to the west.
6541.name: Mine entrance

description: This room smells like wine, and you can only assume it used to be
a wine cellar at one time.
6527.name: Wine cellar

description: Standing on the middle of the mountain, you can easily see the turning
point to the south, and the top of the mountain is very near to the north.
6502.name: Path, middle of mountain

description: The top of the mountain is easily seen from here.
The base of the mountain is near.
You are still circling around on the stairs.  You are starting to
get dizzy from going around and around and around and around and
around.  The stairs continue up and down.
6529.name: Stairs

description: All around you are the mountains of the southern range, home of dwarves and
giants.  You can climb back down the mountains to the west and leave these
realms, or seek riches in the northern mineshafts.  A dirt road leads south,
towards a small building.  You can hear crying and shrieking coming from it.
6500.name: Path to Dwarven Village

description: The path continues.
A rocky road leads back to Westbridge and the mines of Moria.
You are at the bottom of the mineshaft.  The air here is very sooty, and
it is very hard to breath.  The mineshaft leads up and east.
6554.name: Bottom of mineshaft

description: Everything here is covered in soot and very grimy.  The path continues
to the east and north, and there is a door to the west.
6513.name: Inside the entrance

description: The little underground path continues to the north.
The path leads outside the entrance.
This looks like an entrance to some type of store room.
Here there is an entrance to the barracks to the south, and
the path continues to the west.
6521.name: Entrance to barracks

description: You are in a maze.
6548.name: Maze

description: You are on a path that leads to a Hide & Tooth shop to the west, and the
path continues to the south.
6515.name: Turn in road

description: The Hide & Tooth shop is seen to the west.
You are deep inside the mine, and you feel very uncomfortable.  The
path continues to the east, and leads to the mineshaft to the west.
6543.name: Path in the mine

description: This path is very well worn, and there is an entrance to the mines to the
east, while the path continues to the north and west.
6540.name: Dark path

description: You are standing at the foot of the mountains of the dwarven kingdom, where
dwarves and giants toil endlessly to pry gems and mithril from the mother
earth.  Here lies the palace of the dwarven queen, and untold riches.
But beware, for the mines are said to be haunted by demon and spirit alike.
The dwarven kingdom lies to the east.
6562.name: Mountains of the dwarven kingdom

description: The dwarven kingdom awaits!
You see the foothills of this mighty mountain range.
Here the path continues west, and east to the barracks.
6520.name: Path next to barracks

description: This path leads to the north and south.  To the north you can see a
door, and to the south the path continues.
6508.name: Narrow north-south path

description: The guard looks very tough and mean.
6500.name: the dwarven guard~

description: He is very dirty, and looks extremely over-worked.
6501.room_name: A dwarven mining worker is here.
6501.name: the dwarven worker~

description: A black, almost transparent wraith.
6502.room_name: A wraith is awaiting your first move here.
6502.name: the wraith~

description: The storekeeper is very rotund, but looks like a sharp guy.
6503.room_name: There is the Hide & Tooth storekeeper standing here, waiting patiently.
6503.name: the storekeeper~

description: Granite Head is covered with flour and grains.
6504.room_name: Granite Head, the baker, is waiting for a customer here.
6504.name: the baker~

description:
This scaly creature looks like it is well adapted to it's underground
habitat.  He looks very powerful.
6505.name: the giant lizard~

description: The giant is about 8 feet tall, with arms of steel, and looks very strong.
6506.name: the giant~

description: The mineworker is very tired, and very dirty, and he has bulging muscles.
6507.name: the dwarven miner~

description: The mine leader is very big and very strong.
6508.room_name: A dwarven mine leader is here.
6508.name: the dwarven mine leader~

description: He is a very skilled surgeon, with hands of steel.
6509.name: the dwarven doctor~

6510.room_name: A dwarven peon is awaiting help here.
6510.name: the dwarven peon~

6512.room_name: An unwanted son is here.  You feel sorry for the guy.
6512.name: the unwanted son~

6513.room_name: An unwanted daughter is here.  You feel sorry for her.
6513.name: the unwanted daughter~

6515.room_name: A man in waiting is here.  He looks nervous and unsure of himself.
6515.name: the man in waiting~

description: He looks VERY tough.
6516.name: the mazekeeper~

6517.room_name: There is a giant snake here.
6517.name: the giant snake~

description:
This dwarf lives and loves his life as a tattoo artist.  His pride in
his work shows on his walls, elaborately decorated with samples of his work.
A veteran of his trade, he is considered the best at what he does, and will
tell you so.
6518.room_name: A short, stocky dwarf is here, smoking a thick cigar.
6518.name: Gurrok~
subroutines:
M SPEECH 6526 yin-yang~
M SPEECH 6525 unicorn~
M SPEECH 6524 crucifix~
M SPEECH 6523 cobra~
M SPEECH 6522 rose~
M SPEECH 6521 eagle~
M SPEECH 6501 list~
M GRALL 6500 100~
